page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: The historic nature of Bath has caused more than usual outcry at any new plans to build in the city. There is no doubt that hideous mistakes were made in the past e.g. the SOUTHGATE development and the BALANCE ST. FLATS. The BEAUFORT HOTEL also caused concern. However in the last decade a more thoughtful approach to planning appears to have been adopted. Recent developments such as the PLUMMER-RODDIS building, the development in Abbey St and the restoration of GREEN PARK STATION have all been highly successful and won many awards. There is no doubt that further developments will take place before the end of the decade. The next development will be in the centre of the city close to the ROMAN BATHS and will need care and thought.
